title: Midwest Officials Call For Regional Solution To Toxic Algae
teaser: The growing problem with toxic blue-green algae in lakes in the Midwest took the spotlight in August after the Ohio city of Toledo banned its drinking water for two days. Toledo could be a wakeup call for people around Lake Erie, and one advocacy group is calling for a watershed-wide management plan similar to what the Chesapeake Bay has.
